p:define.name: __SUPPORT_NODE
p:define.desc: Run with Node

p:define.name: __AMLVIEWPORT
p:define.short: Element that helps Ajax.org GWT specifying a render area.

p:define.name: __DEBUG
p:define.desc: The Javeline debugger offers various for Web Application developers, like data logging, AML syntax checking/ editing, data source inspection and realtime application profiling.

p:define.name: __WITH_DEBUG_WIN
p:define.desc: The panel is the visualisation of all Javeline Application related interaction for developers.

p:define.name: __WITH_UNSAFE_XMLHTTP
p:define.desc: Uses greasemonkey script for Firefox to enable cross domain scripting for development purpose. The greasemonkey script is available from the download section.

p:define.name: __WITH_UNITTESTER
p:define.desc: Provides a test runner that can run all unit tests, written for and by apf developers

p:define.name: __PROFILER
p:define.desc: Provides a general-purpose, cross-browser compatible code profiling tool with fine-grained output control.

p:define.name: __HIGHLIGHTING
p:define.desc: Enables syntax highlighting of Javascript code

p:define.name: __DESKRUN
p:define.desc: Enables Javeline Deskrun support

p:define.name: __WITH_EVENTRECORDING
p:define.descr: Enables a general purpose, application-wide record and (re)play solution of browser events.

p:define.name: __WITH_XMLDATABASE
p:define.desc: This object routes all changes to the xml data to the data bound objects. It further provides utility functions for xml handling.

p:group.long: Several libraries that can encrypt and/or decrypt data.

p:define.name: __WITH_BASE64
p:define.desc: The base-64 system is a numeral system with 64 as its base. It is the largest power-of-two base that can be represented using single printable ASCII characters. This has led to its use as a transfer encoding for e-mail among other things.

p:define.name: __WITH_BLOWFISH
p:define.desc: Blowfish is a keyed, symmetric block cipher, designed in 1993 by Bruce Schneier and included in a large number of cipher suites and encryption products.

p:define.name: __WITH_MD4
p:define.desc: MD4 is a message digest algorithm (the fourth in a series) designed by Professor Ronald Rivest of MIT in 1990. It implements a cryptographic hash function for use in message integrity checks. The digest length is 128 bits

p:define.name: __WITH_MD5
p:define.desc: MD5 (Message-Digest algorithm 5) is a widely used cryptographic hash function with a 128-bit hash value. An MD5 hash is typically expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number.

p:define.name: __WITH_SHA1
p:define.desc: SHA stands for Secure Hash Algorithm. SHA-1 produces a message digest that is 160 bits long.

p:define.name: __WITH_RSA
p:define.desc: RSA is an algorithm for public-key cryptography. It is the first algorithm known to be suitable for signing as well as encryption.

p:define.name: __WITH_BARRETT
p:define.desc: Provides Barrett computations with Big Integers; used by the RSA implementation

p:define.name: __WITH_BIGINT
p:define.desc: Provides support for Big Integers in Javascript; used by the RSA implementation

p:define.name: __WITH_ABSTRACTEVENT
p:define.desc: Used by several components to aid in cross-browser compatible event handling and behaviors.

p:define.name: __WITH_DATE
p:define.desc: Enables the utility library for Date parsing and i18n features; provides developers with a powerful set of tools to manipulate timestamps and format dates according to a locale

p:define.name: __WITH_CSS
p:define.desc: Enables a set of utility functions to manipulate Cascading StyleSheet rules.

p:define.name: __WITH_DRAGMODE
p:define.desc: Provides a drag and drop interface to components and HTML DOM elements

p:define.name: __WITH_ECMAEXT
p:define.desc: Enables basic extensions to the ECMA script (javascript) language

p:define.name: __WITH_UUID
p:define.desc: Provides an extension to the Math class (Math.uuid) that generates RFC 4142 compliant UUIDs

p:define.name: __WITH_ENTITY_ENCODING
p:define.desc: Enables type-safe encoding of XML(-like) entities

p:define.name: __WITH_COLORS
p:define.desc: Provide ways to work with colors

p:define.name: __WITH_FLASH
p:define.desc: Provides an advanced interface to integrate Flash movies and optimize Flash - Javascript communication (ExternalInterface)

p:define.name: __WITH_CLASS
p:define.desc: Baseclass for any object offering property binding, event handling, constructor and destructor hooks.

p:define.name: __WITH_CDN
p:define.desc: Use our Content Delivery Network to get additional apf resources from

p:define.name: __WITH_HISTORY
p:define.desc: Allows developers to re-claim the Back button of the browser inside a Javeline Web Application.

p:define.name: __WITH_COOKIE
p:define.desc: Cookies can may be used as a simple local storage mechanism for key/ value based data.

p:define.name: __AMLCONTEXTMENU
p:define.desc: Enables declarative context menu handling.

p:define.name: __WITH_CONVENIENCE_API
p:define.desc: Supplements the standard DOM API of AML elements with additional accessor methods, i.e. 'getWidth' and 'setWidth'

p:define.name: __WITH_DATA
p:define.desc: Data instructions provide a way to store or retrieve data from a datasource

p:define.name: __WITH_JSLT_EVENTS
p:define.desc: Adds support for LiveMarkup events

p:define.name: __WITH_FOCUS
p:define.desc: Enables solid and advanced state management for Web Application from the Window object to individual components.

p:define.name: __WITH_WINDOW_FOCUS
p:define.desc: Detects whether the browser window has focus.

p:define.name: __WITH_TASKBAR_FLASHING
p:define.desc: Makes the windows taskbar flash when the application is blurred.

p:define.name: __WITH_ALIAS
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves the alternative name for this element.The alias attribute can be set on another element. Only one element can have the alias at one time. This way it's easy to use different elements in the same function (for instance a thumbail and a datagrid) while keeping all the binding rules and events on the active element.

p:define.name: __WITH_HOTKEY
p:define.desc: Enables support for assigning actions to specific key combinations (hotkeys)

p:define.name: __WITH_KEYBOARD
p:define.desc: Enable application-wide keyboard event handling

p:define.name: __WITH_PROPERTY_BINDING
p:define.desc: Enables support of AML elements attaching hooks to properties of other AML elements.

p:define.name: __WITH_PROPERTY_WATCH
p:define.desc: Watches for a property to be assigned a value and runs a function when that occurs.

p:define.name: __WITH_PROPERTY_CHANGE
p:define.desc: Fires when a property changes.

p:define.name: __WITH_REGISTRY
p:define.desc: A way to store name/value pairs. This object is useful for storing information that is needed in an offline application.

p:define.name: __WITH_TWEEN
p:define.desc: Enables support for tweening between CSS states.

p:define.name: __WITH_STORAGE
p:define.desc: Storage can be used to store states and data while the application is offline, but also serve as a simple, local data source

p:define.name: __WITH_STORAGE_AIR
p:define.desc: Store simple key/ value paired data through the Adobe Air bridge.

p:define.name: __WITH_STORAGE_AIR_FILE
p:define.desc: Use the Adobe Air file-based storage feature

p:define.name: __WITH_STORAGE_AIR_SQL
p:define.desc: Use the Adobe Air file-based storage feature with support for S(tructured)Q(uery)L(anguage)

p:define.name: __WITH_STORAGE_MEMORY
p:define.desc: Use non-persistent, local memory only for temporary storage.

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE
p:define.desc: With Javeline Offline support you can continue working inside any Javeline based RIA, even if the Internet Connection is (temporarily) unavailable. All state management, data synchronisation and offline storage issues are taken care of.

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_TRANSACTIONS
p:define.desc: State management

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_MODELS
p:define.desc: Data synchronisation

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_MODEL
p:define.desc: Data synchronisation

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_STATE
p:define.desc: State management 2

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_QUEUE
p:define.desc: State management 3; queue support for undo/ redo stacks

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_DETECTOR
p:define.desc: Detects whether the application is state in online or offline

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_APPLICATION
p:define.desc: Adds offline support for jml applications.It can store and restore the state of the application, the models, any transaction that occurred whilst being offline, queuing actions (ActionTracker state) and state of the runtime application itself (all properties of each element). This allows the application to return to the exact state the user left it, when needed. This means that when enabled you can at any moment turn of your computer (i.e. remove the battery) and when your computer starts up whilst sitting in the train start the application and continue working as if the application was never closed.

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_GEARS
p:define.desc: Use Google Gears for offline storage

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFLINE_STATE_REALTIME
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves whether changes are stored realtime.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_IE
p:define.desc: Internet Explorer has been, and still is by many, considered as market leader of all web browsers.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_IE5
p:define.desc: This is a very old version of IE, you probably do not want this.

p:define.name: __WITH_POPUP_IE
p:define.desc: Since a popup created with createPopup() does not appear outside the browser chrome when the web application is running in the Internet Zone, we decided not to enable it by default.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_GECKO
p:define.desc: Gecko is the HTML/ XUL/ CSS rendering and Javascript engine that powers the Firefox browser, among others.

p:define.name: __WITH_ELEMENT_FROM_POINT
p:define.desc: This function is implemented in FF3/ Gecko 1.9.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_WEBKIT
p:define.desc: A cross-platform HTML/ CSS rendering and Javascript engine.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_SAFARI2
p:define.desc: Yes, the one with all the bugs.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_CHROME
p:define.desc: The new browser on the block by Google.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_GEARS
p:define.desc: Google Gears is a browser extension/ plugin that aims to add missing features in browser like Firefox, IE and Safari.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_JAW
p:define.desc: J(avascript) A(ctually) W(orks) is a command line javascript interface created by Javeline.

p:define.name: __SUPPORT_IPHONE
p:define.desc: The Apple iPhone is a fully web-enabled handheld device that uses Safari as its webbrowser

p:define.name: __PARSE_GET_VARS
p:define.desc: Provides an accessible object for reading GET variables from the application URL

p:define.name: __PARSER_AML
p:define.desc: Engine for the Javeline Markup Language; the Javeline Markup Language provides developers with a standard method of creating complex layouts and application designs in a declarative manner.

p:define.name: __WITH_SKIN_INCLUDES
p:define.desc: Use an include in the skins file

p:define.name: __WITH_PARTIAL_AML_LOADING
p:define.desc: Enables support for inline AML; snippets of a AML application inside an (X)HTML webpage

p:define.name: __WITH_PARSE_DOC_BY_RELOADING
p:define.short: Load xml document by reloading the index file

p:define.name: __WITH_PARTIAL_AML_LOADING_FROM_COMMENT
p:define.desc: Enables support for inline AML; snippets of a AML application inside XML comments

p:define.name: __WITH_PARSE_AML_FROM_HTML
p:define.desc: Enables support for inline AML; snippets of a AML application inside an HTML element

p:define.name: __WITH_HTML_POSITIONING
p:define.desc: Enables support for advanced layout rules for HTML elements in addition to AML elements.

p:define.name: __PARSER_XSLT
p:define.desc: Abstraction for browsers that have not implemented XSLT, falls back to native implementations if available.

p:define.name: __PARSER_LM
p:define.desc: Live Markup is an extension to Javascript, and it allows APF to have a simple consistent syntax for all attribute values and templates. Live markup is used for templating, rpc, data binding, property binding, formatting and even events. Live Markup generates text-output via the default-output of statements, and APF maintains knowledge of all properties and data used to create this output allowing for a Live update when any of this information changes. Nearly all attributes in APF are processed as a live markup ' ' string Some attributes (like events) and <?lm ?> blocks are processed as code.

p:define.name: __PARSER_XPATH
p:define.desc: Abstraction for browsers that have not implemented XPath, falls back to native implementations if available.

p:define.name: __PARSER_XSD
p:define.desc: browsers that have not implemented XSD, falls back to native implementations if available.

p:define.name: __PARSER_URL
p:define.desc: Parses a Uniform Resource Locator into an accessible object for developers.

p:define.name: __PARSER_XFORMS
p:define.desc: Parses a XForms.

p:define.name: __PARSER_XINCLUDE
p:define.desc: Parses XInclude.

p:define.name: __WITH_HTML_CLEANER
p:define.desc: Parses a HTML.

p:define.name: __PARSER_XHTML
p:define.desc: Parses a XHTML.

p:define.name: __WITH_ALIGNMENT
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves the data instruction to retrieve the layout xml definition.

p:define.name: __WITH_DOCKING
p:define.desc: All elements inheriting from this baseclass have docking features.

p:define.name: __WITH_SPLITTERS
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves the size of splitter that is placed between this and the neighbouring element to the right or top.When not specified, the splitter is not displayed.

p:define.name: __WITH_ALIGN_TEMPLATES
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves the edge of the parent to which this element aligns.Possible values are a combination of: 'left', 'middle', 'right', 'top', 'bottom' and 'slider' and optionally a size.

p:define.name: __WITH_DATAACTION
p:define.desc: Baseclass adding data action features to this element.

p:define.name: __WITH_LIVEEDIT
p:define.desc: Baseclass of an element whose content is editable.

p:define.name: __WITH_CSS_BINDS
p:define.desc: Enables support for a dynamic 'css' property on visual AML elements.

p:define.name: __WITH_SORTING
p:define.desc: A set of algorithms that solves most of the sorting problems and makes it easy for developers to add sorting to their elements and data.

p:define.name: __WITH_STYLE
p:define.desc: Enables a set of utility functions to manipulate Cascading StyleSheet rules.

p:define.name: __WITH_OFFSET
p:define.desc: Port of the jQuery.offset() function to calculate offsets for HTML elements

p:define.name: __WITH_DELAYEDRENDER
p:define.desc: Any element that is (partially) hidden at startup has the possibility to delay rendering it's childNodes by setting render='runtime' on the element. These elements include window, tab, pages, form and container. For instance a Tab page in a container is initally hidden and does not need to be rendered. When the tab button is pressed to activate the page the page is rendered and then displayed. This can dramatically decrease the startup time of the application.

p:define.name: __WITH_DRAGDROP
p:define.desc: Element containing all the dragdrop rules for the data bound elements referencing this element.

p:define.name: __WITH_LANG_SUPPORT
p:define.desc: Enables support for multi-language application and live language switching

p:define.name: __WITH_INTERACTIVE
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves whether an element is draggable.The user will able to move the element around while holding the mouse button down on the element.

p:define.name: __WITH_OUTLINE
p:define.desc: Shows an outline while dragging or resizing

p:define.name: __WITH_MULTISELECT
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves whether the data nodes of this element can be selected.Default is true.

p:define.name: __WITH_PRESENTATION
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves the skinset for this element.If none is specified the skinset attribute of is used. When not defined the default skinset is accessed.

p:define.name: __WITH_SKIN_CHANGE
p:define.desc: Enables support for changing between skins dynamically.

p:define.name: __WITH_RENAME
p:define.desc: Rename is triggered by pressing F2 on an item or by clicking once on an already selected item. This will show an input element in place where the user can change the name of the item to a new one. When the caption is changed the data node is changed accordingly.

p:define.name: __WITH_TRANSACTION
p:define.desc: A transaction is a set of changes to data which are treated as one change. When one of the changes in the set fails, all the changes will be cancelled. In the case of a gui this is mostly relevant when a user decides to cancel after making several changes. A good example are the well known property windows with an ok, cancel and apply button. When a user edits data, for instance user information, all the changes are seen as one edit and put on the undo stack as a single action. Thus clicking undo will undo the entire transaction, not just the last change done by that user in the edit window. Transaction support both optimistic and pessimistic locking. For more information on the latter see the first example below.

p:define.name: __WITH_VALIDATION
p:define.desc: All elements inheriting from this baseclass have validation support.

p:define.name: __WITH_A11Y
p:define.desc: All elements inheriting from this have accessibility features.

p:group.desc: Javeline Components for use in a AML document

p:group.name: Containers

p:define.name: __WITH_LIVEMARKUP
p:define.desc: Live Markup processor for a processing instruction

p:define.name: __WITH_LIVETEXT
p:define.desc: Live Text processor (subset of Live Markup) for a processing instruction

p:define.name: __AMLBAR
p:define.desc: Element displaying a skinnable rectangle which can contain other jml elements.This element is used by other elements such as the toolbar and statusbar element to specify sections within those elements which in turn can contain other jml elements.

p:define.name: __AMLFRAME
p:define.desc: Element displaying a frame with a caption, containing other elements.This element is called a fieldset in html.

p:define.name: __AMLMODALWINDOW
p:define.desc: Window inside the browser window. You can use it as a normal window, a portal widget or a dockable window. Optionally enable the Interactive baseclass to make the window draggable and resizable.

p:define.name: __WITH_WINDOW_ANIMATIONS
p:define.short: Adds transittion options to a modal window to appear or move away with effect

p:define.name: __AMLSTATUSBAR
p:define.desc: Element displaying a bar consisting of panels containing other text, icons and more jml.This element is usually placed in the bottom of the screen to display context sensitive and other information about the state of the application.

p:define.name: __AMLTAB
p:define.desc: Transform a generic function to be Profile-able, independent of its implementation.Element displaying a page and several buttons allowing a user to switch between the pages. Each page can contain arbitrary jml. Each page can render it's content during startup of the application or when the page is activated.

p:group.p:define: <p:define name="__ENABLE_TAB_ORDER" match="" short="Enable dragging tabs" requires="" desc="" /

p:define.name: __AMLTOOLBAR
p:define.desc: Element displaying a bar containing buttons and other jml elements.This element is usually positioned in the top of an application allowing the user to choose from grouped buttons.

p:define.name: __AMLBUTTON
p:define.desc: Element displaying a clickable rectangle that visually confirms to the user when the area is clicked and then executes a command.

p:define.name: __AMLCALDROPDOWN
p:define.desc: Element displaying a list of day numbers in a grid, ordered by week.It allows the user to choose the month and year for which to display the days. Calendar returns a date in chosen date format. Minimal size of calendar is 150px.

p:define.name: __AMLCALENDAR
p:define.desc: Element displaying a list of day numbers in a grid, ordered by week.It allows the user to choose the month and year for which to display the days. Calendar returns a date in chosen date format. Minimal size of calendar is 150px.

p:define.name: __AMLCHECKBOX
p:define.desc: Element displaying a clickable rectangle having two states which can be toggled by user interaction.

p:define.name: __AMLDROPDOWN
p:define.desc: Element allowing a user to select a value from a list, which is displayed when the user clicks a button.

p:define.name: __AMLERRORBOX
p:define.desc: Element showing an error message when the attached element is in erroneous state and has the invalidmsg='' attribute specified.In most cases the errorbox element is implicit and will be created automatically.

p:define.name: __AMLLABEL
p:define.desc: Element displaying a text in the user interface, usually specifying a description of another element.When the user clicks on the label it can set the focus to the connected jml element.

p:define.name: __AMLPALETTE
p:define.desc: Element displaying a set of choices to the user which allows him/her to pick a specific color.This element also gives the user a choice to add a custom color.

p:define.name: __AMLPROGRESSBAR
p:define.desc: Element graphically representing a percentage value which increases automatically with time.This element is most often used to show the progress of a process. The progress can be either indicative or exact.

p:define.name: __AMLRADIOBUTTON
p:define.desc: Element displaying a two state button which is one of a grouped set.Only one of these buttons in the set can be checked at the same time.

p:define.name: __AMLSLIDER
p:define.desc: Element allowing the user to select a value from a range of values between a minimum and a maximum value.

p:define.name: __AMLSPINNER
p:define.desc: This element is used to choosing number by plus/minus buttons.When plus button is clicked longer, number growing up faster. The same situation is for minus button. It's possible to increment and decrement value by moving mouse cursor up or down with clicked input. Max and min attributes define range with allowed values.

p:define.name: __AMLTEXT
p:define.desc: Element displaying a rectangle containing arbritrary (X)HTML.This element can be databound and use databounding rules to convert data into (X)HTML using for instance XSLT or JSLT.

p:define.name: __AMLTEXTAREA
p:define.desc: Alias to the textbox element

p:define.name: __AMLTEXTBOX
p:define.desc: Element displaying a rectangular area wich allows a user to type information.The information typed can be restricted by using masking. The information can also be hidden from view when used in password mode. By adding an autocomplete element as a child the value for the textbox can be looked up as you type. By setting the mask atribute, complex data input validation is done while the users types.

p:define.name: __ENABLE_TEXTBOX_MASKING
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves a complex input pattern that the user should adhere to.This is a string which is a combination of special and normal characters. Then comma seperated it has two options. The first option specifies whether the non input characters (the chars not typed by the user) are in the value of this element. The second option specifies the character that is displayed when the user hasn't yet filled in a character.

p:define.name: __AMLPAGES
p:define.desc: Alias to the tab element

p:define.name: __AMLSWITCH
p:define.desc: Alias to the tab element

p:define.name: __AMLINPUT
p:define.desc: Alias to the textbox element

p:define.name: __AMLDIVIDER
p:define.desc: Element displaying a divider. For use in toolbars, menu's and such.

p:define.name: __AMLMARKUPEDIT
p:define.desc: Element for editing markup in the same way firebug provides.

p:define.name: __AMLRANGE
p:define.desc: Alias to the slider element

p:define.name: __AMLSECRET
p:define.desc: Alias to the textbox element

p:define.name: __AMLSUBMITFORM
p:define.desc: Element allowing special form functionality to a set of AML elements.This element is an alias for a:xforms offering xform compatible strategies with relation to submitting the form's data. This element also offers form paging, including validation across pages. Buttons placed inside this element can contain an action attribute specifying whether they behave as next, previous or finish(submit) buttons. This element is not necesary for simple forms, like the normal html webforms (see the validation baseclass). This element should be used when multi page forms are required, or a wizard style form.

p:define.name: __AMLCOLLECTION
p:define.desc: Virtual element acting as a parent for a set of child elements but only draws it's children.It doesn't have any representation itself.

p:define.name: __AMLCOLORPICKER
p:define.desc: Element giving the user a visual choice of several colors presented in a grid.

p:define.name: __AMLUPLOAD
p:define.desc: Element allowing the user to upload a file to a server.This element does not have a visual representation. By adding buttons, a progressbar and other elements you can fully customize your upload component. Use property binding to update those elements with the state of the upload element.

p:define.name: __AMLPAGER
p:define.desc: This elements displays buttons which can be used to navigate between some parts of data, for example between parts of article

p:define.name: __AMLCOMMENT
p:define.desc: All elements within the comment tag are ignored by the parser.

p:define.name: __AMLLINESELECT
p:define.desc: Element displaying text with each line being selectable. This is especially useful for log messages.

p:define.name: __AMLPAGE
p:define.desc: A page in a pageable element. (i.e. a page in a tab)

p:define.name: __AMLLOADINDICATOR
p:define.short: A more advanced replacement for animated GIF based loader images

p:define.name: __AMLDATAGRID
p:define.desc: Element providing a sortable, selectable grid containing scrollable information. Grid columns can be reordered and resized.

p:define.name: __AMLLIST
p:define.desc: Element displaying a skinnable list of options which can be selected.Selection of multiple items can be allowed. Items can be renamed and removed. The list can be used as a collection of checkboxes or radiobuttons. This is especially useful for use in forms. This element is one of the most often used elements. It can display lists of items in a cms style interface or display a list of search results in a more website like interface.

p:define.name: __AMLTREE
p:define.desc: Element displaying data in a list where each item in the list can contain such a list.This element gives the user the ability to walk through this tree of data by clicking open elements to show more elements. The tree can grow by fetching more data when the user requests it.

p:define.name: __AMLPROPEDIT
p:define.desc: Element providing a sortable, selectable grid containing scrollable information. Grid columns can be reordered and resized.

p:define.name: __AMLMENU
p:define.desc: Element displaying a skinnable menu of items which can be choosen.Based on the context of the menu, items can be shown and hidden. That's why this element is often called a contextmenu.

p:define.name: __AMLITEM
p:define.desc: Item of a menu displaying a clickable area.

p:define.name: __AMLTOC
p:define.desc: Element acting as the navigational instrument for any element based on BaseTab.This element displays buttons which can be used to navigate the different pages of for instance a submitform or pages element. This element is page validation aware and can display current page progress when connected to a submitform.

p:define.name: __AMLTABLE
p:define.desc: Any child element of this element is placed in a grid.The size of the columns and rows of the grid can be set by attributes. Child elements can span multiple columns. Using '*' as a size indicator will use the remaining size for that column or row, when the grid's size is set.

p:define.name: __AMLHBOX
p:define.desc: Container that stacks it's children horizontally.

p:define.name: __AMLPORTAL
p:define.desc: Portal widget (aka dashboard) displaying multiple windows with content and settings panel in one or more columns.

p:define.name: __AMLVBOX
p:define.desc: Container that stacks it's children vertically.

p:define.name: __AMLBROWSER
p:define.desc: Element displaying the rendered contents of an URL.

p:define.name: __AMLIMG
p:define.desc: Element displaying a picture.This element can read databound resources.

p:define.name: __AMLSLIDESHOW
p:define.desc: This element is used for viewing images.It's possible to add thumbnails and a description to each of them. You can select a displayed image in several ways. With a mouse buttons, the mousewheel or keyboard arrows. The thumbnails allow the user to quickly select the image from the displayed list.

p:define.name: __AMLGALLERY
p:define.desc: This element is used for viewing images.It's possible to add thumbnails and a description to each of them. You can select a displayed image in several ways. With a mouse buttons, the mousewheel or keyboard arrows. The thumbnails allow the user to quickly select the image from the displayed list.

p:define.name: __AMLNOTIFIER
p:define.desc: Notification element, which shows popups when events occur.Similar to growl on the OSX platform.

p:define.name: __AMLEVENT
p:define.desc: Displays a popup element with a message with optionally an icon at the position specified by the position attribute. After the timeout has passed the popup will dissapear automatically. When the mouse hovers over the popup it doesn't dissapear.

p:define.name: __AMLAUDIO
p:define.desc: Element that is able to play an audio file or remote stream.

p:define.name: __AMLVIDEO
p:define.desc: Element that is able to play a video file or remote stream.

p:define.name: __AMLFLASHPLAYER
p:define.desc: Element displaying the contents of a .swf (adobe flash) file.

p:define.name: __AMLFLOWCHART
p:define.desc: Element is implementing adding and removing block elements.Every block could be rotated, flipped, resized, renamed, locked and moved. It's possible to add connections between them.

p:define.name: __AMLFLOWCHART2
p:define.desc: Element is implementing adding and removing block elements.Every block could be rotated, flipped, resized, renamed, locked and moved. It's possible to add connections between them.

p:define.name: __AMLREPEAT
p:define.desc: Element that defines a template of jml which is repeated for a list of selected data nodes.Each template instance is databound to the same data node.

p:define.name: __WITH_ACTIONTRACKER
p:define.desc: Element keeping track of all user actions that are triggered in GUI elements.This element maintains a stack of actions and knows how to undo & redo them. It is aware of how to synchronize the changes to the backend data store. With offline support enabled the actiontracker can serialize both its undo stack and its execution stack such that these can be kept in between application sessions. This means that a user will be able to close the application and start it at a later date whilst keeping his or her entire undo/redo stack. Furthermore all changes done whilst being offline will be synchronized to the data store when the application comes online.

p:define.name: __WITH_SMARTBINDINGS
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves the id of the bindings element that contains the binding rules for all elements connected to this smartbinding element.

p:define.name: __AMLTEMPLATE
p:define.desc: Defines a template for jml elements.

p:define.name: __AMLICONMAP
p:define.desc: Enable support for image maps, containing icons, defined by CSS rules

p:define.name: __WITH_APPSETTINGS
p:define.desc: Element specifying the settings of the application.

p:define.name: __WITH_IEPNGFIX
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves whether the fix for PNG images with transparency should be applied.

p:define.name: __WITH_APP_DEFAULTS
p:define.desc: Enables support for setting defaults for any AML element inside the <a:appsettings> element

p:define.name: __WITH_PRINTER
p:define.desc: Sents html to a printer in formatted form.

p:define.name: __WITH_QUERYAPPEND
p:define.desc: Enables support for appending a (pair of) variable(s) to the query string of all request made with Teleport

p:define.name: __WITH_UNDO_KEYS
p:define.desc: Sets or retrieves whether the undo and redo keys (in windows they are ctrl-Z and ctrl-Y) are enabled.

p:define.name: __WITH_AUTH
p:define.desc: Provides a mechanism to deal with various types of user authentication and integrates seamlessly with Teleport modules.

p:define.name: __WITH_RDB
p:define.desc: Element allowing data synchronization between multiple clients using the same application or application part.This element is designed as thecore of collaborative application logic for Javeline PlatForm. The children of this element specify how the uniqueness of data nodes is determined. By pointing models to this element, all changes to their data will be streamed through this element to all listening client over a choosen protocol.

p:define.name: __WITH_MODEL
p:define.desc: Element functioning as the central access point for xml data.Data can be retrieved from any data source using data instructions. Data can be submitted using data instructions in a similar way to html form posts. The modal can be reset to it's original state. It has support for offline use and synchronization between multiple clients.

p:define.name: __AMLTELEPORT
p:define.desc: Element which specifies the ways the application can communicate to remote data sources.

p:define.name: __TP_IFRAME
p:define.desc: For secured environments. IE only.

p:define.name: __TP_WEBDAV
p:define.desc: Implementation (reference) of the WebDAV remote filesystem protocol; WebDAV is generally used for collaborative content editing/ management, because it offers simple file locking mechanisms to provide fail-safe transactions and the ability to perform atomic saves on your documents that are on a webserver. See http://www.webdav.org for more information about WebDAV.

p:define.name: __TP_XMPP
p:define.desc: Implementation (reference) of the XMPP (Jabber) Instant Messaging and Presence Notification protocol; The XMPP standard for messaging and presence can be used for live chats between, let's say, your clients and a company representative, but it also powers our Remote SmartBindings feature.

p:define.name: __TP_XMPP_ROSTER
p:define.desc: Element implementing a Roster service for the apf.xmpp object. The Roster is a centralised registry for Jabber ID's (JID) to which the user subscribed. Whenever the presence info of a JID changes, the roster will get updated accordingly.

p:define.name: __TP_XMPP_MUC
p:define.desc: Interface implementing a Multi User Chat service for the apf.xmpp object. The Multi User Chat class is a class that contains all the functions needed to start, end, join, leave any XMPP/ Jabber chat room, and more.

p:define.name: __TP_XMPP_RDB
p:define.desc: Interface implementing a Multi User Chat service for the apf.xmpp object. The Multi User Chat class is a class that contains all the functions needed to start, end, join, leave any XMPP/ Jabber chat room, and more.

p:define.name: __TP_PERSIST
p:define.short: Persistent connection layer for bidirectional data streams over a keep-alive http connection.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC
p:define.desc: Modules are available for SOAP, XML-RPC, CGI, JSON-RPC and several proprietary protocols.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_CGI
p:define.desc: Implementation of the Common Gateway Interface (CGI) as a module for the RPC plugin of apf.teleport.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_HEADER
p:define.desc: Implementation of an RPC protocol which encodes the variable information in the HTTP headers of the request.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_JPHP
p:define.desc: Implementation of an RPC protocol which encodes the data in a serialized format in the same way as the php serialize() function does. It requires json in return. This protocol was originally designed to make use of the native unserializer methods on both sides of the line.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_JSON
p:define.desc: Implementation of the JSON-RPC protocol as a module for the RPC plugin of apf.teleport.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_SOAP
p:define.desc: Implementation of the SOAP RPC protocol.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_XMLRPC
p:define.desc: Implementation of the XML-RPC protocol as a module for the RPC plugin of apf.teleport.

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_YQL
p:define.desc: Implementation of the Yahoo! Query Language as a module for the RPC

p:define.name: __TP_RPC_RDB
p:define.desc: Implementation of the Remote DataBinding RPC protocol as a module for the RPC plugin of apf.teleport.
